channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree Branch, 3rd October
item.description:
Outside no.40 Edmunds Avenue on the grass verge there is a large tree branch that snapped from tree please can you remove.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Edmunds Avenue, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned trailer loaded with waste, 3rd October
item.description:
A trailer loaded with waste has been left by the kerb for several days. Presumably the owner is not returning to collect it, a tyre is burst and the trailer looks as though it's end-of-life

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Siward Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 24 woodchurch road, 3rd October
item.description:
This site has been like this for more than 15 years. Now the hording is unsafe - site unlocked and open to the public - the passageway to my home is now too narrow to be legal and my pathway is slipping into the site itself so is now at an extremely angle. I have contacted the planning department and they have also advised to contact you as I believe this is a possible dangerous site to people walking on the street. Any and all help would be very much appreciated Planning reference is 08/2/0050-25/DS/0013 Yours Philippa Dale Owner of part of 22 Woodchurch Road 07717 153488
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Woodchurch Road, South Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wet dog fouling on the road, which is in the kerb. And is parallel to 95 Fernhead Road., 3rd October
item.description:
Wet dog fouling on the road, which is in the kerb. And is parallel to 95 Fernhead Road. Thank you in anticipation.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 95, Fernhead Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Adjacent to the "new" development of former council offices on West End Lane, 3rd October
item.description:
The pavement is in shocking condition, dangerous, a health and safety hazard, an eyesore and manifestly not fit for purpose. The "temporary" planters which have been installed on the most dangerous part of the sloping pavement are now being used as rubbish bins, the plants having died months ago. It is appalling that this stretch of pavement - used by a very large number of pedestrians every day - has been allowed to stay in this unacceptable condition for so many months. Please treat the matter with the urgency it deserves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, West End Lane, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, Carisbrooke Avenue, Albany Park, London

item.title: Traffic Noise on Median Road, 3rd October
item.description:
Please PLEASE put up signage to discourage cars from constantly beeping their horns on median road just because the traffic isn't moving as fast as they would like. People live on these houses and 24/7 beeping is affecting our peace.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Median Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Another tree damaged by delivery vehicle, 3rd October
item.description:
This tree near no 2-4 Pickwick Rd has been knocked sideways by a truck. It could be rescued as rootball looks still intact if action taken quickly - could your wonderful tree experts come and review and firm up the roots so it is straight? Many thanks!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickwick Road, Dulwich Village, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uber delivery bikes illegally parked on pavement, 3rd October
item.description:
These two have been parked all day illegally om the pavement, presumably to advertise to the building opposite. Please have them removed. Please also regulate these food delivery companies properly - their bikes seem to have more rights than people, are often illegally powered and do not have lights. Make them play by the rules

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
